tags.description:
### Ads Rate Limits The Ads endpoints (e.g `/ads/v4/*` listed under `ENDPOINTS - ADS(V4)`) adhere to any one of 4 Rate Limit categories.
- **READ** - 500 queries per minute. - **READ HIGH** - 1000 queries per minute. - **WRITE** - 400 queries per minute. - **METRICS** - 300 queries per minute.
You can find this info by viewing an Ads endpoint spec. For example, Get ads has a rate limit category of `READ HIGH`.
**Note:** API calls to the same rate limit category are accumulative even if those calls are spread across different endpoints. #### Ads API v4 response header You can inspect the response header to determine the limit and remaining number of calls.
- **RateLimit-Limit** - The rate limit - **RateLimit-Remaining** - The remaining number of calls - **Retry-After** - minimum time (in seconds) before you should attempt to make another request In v4 - We now only return rate limit headers when your request is limited. The format of the rate limit headers has also been updated to align with the IETF RateLimit headers draft spec. RateLimit-Limit - provides information about the limit that has been reached including the quota and time window that apply
RateLimit-Remaining - will be 0, indicating there is no more quota to expend
Retry-After - minimum time (in seconds) before you should attempt to make another request, but not a guarantee that your request will be successful after this time
**Example #1 - per user limit**
A per user or advertiser limit has been reached (but your app overall can continue to make requests). RateLimit-Limit: 30, 30;w=60
RateLimit-Remaining: 0
Retry-After: 30
The limit quota here is defined as "30;w=60" or "30 requests per 60 seconds". The reset field indicates there are 30 seconds left in the window that this limit was triggered. **Example #2 - per app (aka "client") limit**
A per app limit has been reached (but the specific user you are making requests for is not being limited). RateLimit-Limit: 1000, 1000;w=60
RateLimit-Remaining: 0
Retry-After: 30
The limit quota here is defined as "1000;w=60" or "1000 requests per 60 seconds". The reset field indicates there are 30 seconds left in the window that this limit was triggered. **Example #3 - Pinterest backend service limit**
In the case of downstream capacity/availability issues with our internal systems - we may apply a generic limit that isn't necessarily related to your app's or users' behavior. RateLimit-Limit: 0, 0
RateLimit-Remaining: 0
Retry-After: 2
Reminder: the `Retry-After` value here is the minimum time your client should wait before making another request, but not a guarantee that your request will be successful.

#### Ads API v3 response header You can inspect the response header to determine the limit and remaining number of calls.
- x-userendpoint-ratelimit-limit - The rate limit - x-userendpoint-ratelimit-remaining - The remaining number of calls - x-userendpoint-ratelimit-reset-seconds - The amount of seconds until remaining value gets reset. For example, the latest response header will denote a limit of 1000, remaining of 997, and reset-seconds of 40 if you make 3 API calls to any endpoint with a READ HIGH category in the last 20 seconds. ### Organic Rate Limits The Organic endpoints (e.g `/v3/*` listed under `ENDPOINTS - ORGANIC(V3)`) adhere to a more general rate limit. #### Organic API response header You can inspect the response header to determine the limit and remaining number of calls.
- • **x-userendpoint-ratelimit-limit** - The rate limit - • **x-userendpoint-ratelimit-remaining** - The remaining number of calls you have left in a 60-minute window.
For example, the latest response header will denote a limit of `100000` and remaining of `99997` if you make **3** API calls to any Organic endpoint in the last `60 minutes`.
**Note:** Your rate limit may vary depending on the type of integration you currently have. We recommend you inspect the response header for the organic endpoint calls to determine which rate limit applies to your App.

#### Exceeding rate limits If you exceed your rate limit, youll get a `429: Too many requests error code.`
tags.name: Rate Limits

tags.description:
Endpoints that return an object array (e.g pin object array) support the `page_size` and `bookmark` query parameters to paginate throught the results. Please reference the table below for the relevant query parameter information.
Query parameter Description
page_size integer, Default: 25, How many objects to return. Max supported value is 250.
bookmark string, Default: "", String returned after page_size items or more. Include on subsequent calls to get more.
Example with GET [User's Pins](#operation/v3_get_pins_handler_GET) /v3/users/{user}/pins/?page_size=100
Subsequent calls to get the next set of results. The `bookmark` value can be found at the root level of the previous response. /v3/users/{user}/pins/?page_size=100&bookmark={bookmark} ***
tags.name: Pagination

tags.description:
Pinners are in a unique mindset on Pinterest in that they are seeking, but undecided. Understanding your Pinner audience is vital in turning inspiration to action.
Pinterests Analytics API provides partners with the ability to analyze organic and promoted Pin performance as well as obtain audience insights. These endpoints are read-only and do not allow the creation of Pins, Boards, or Ads.
- User and Pin - Pin stats - Campaign, Pin Promotion, and Ad Groups - Organic metrics - Advertising - Audience Insights - Account Sharing examples
**Access to this data requires the following conditions to be met:** 1. The user has a business account on Pinterest. Find details on account [creating a Business account](https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/get-a-business-account). 2. The users account has a `country` setting in one of [Pinterests advertising markets](https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/promoted-pins-overview). 3. If wanting ad performance, the user has an advertiser account set up and has run ads.   ## User and Pin Get the authenticated user's profile and pins. ##### GET /v3/users/{user}/ See User API Reference ##### GET /v3/users/{user}/pins/ See User Pins API Reference

You can also get metadata about a specific Pin when only a Pin ID is known. The Pin must be owned by the authenticated user. ##### GET /v3/pins/{pin}/ See Pin API Reference
  ## Pin stats Pin stats allow you to detremine pin performance. The `pin_stats` object is available in the Pin response and only populated if it is owned by the authenticated user and has generated enough engagement. `null` otherwise.
There are two different types of pin stats
**Canonical Pin Stats:** If the user has claimed their website, they will see total stats for any pins pointing to their claimed website ("total pin stats"). We preference showing total pin stats anytime it is available to the user.
**Root Pin Stats:** If they create a new pin (via pin it button, upload via mobile or desktop flows, API creation, etc) they will see stats for their pin and any downstream activity ("root pin stats"). We fall back to showing root pin stats if its available.
**Note:** Users do NOT get to see pin stats on repins. Pin stats only shows if its a pin pointing to the user's claimed website, or if the user created a new pin. For both cases, the user must be a business account when creating the pin in order for pin stats to be processed.
Helpful link: [Pin Stats](https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/pin-stats)
- Reference `video_signature` on the Pin object to determine if Pin is a video pin (ignore is_video as it doesnt apply in this context). - Reference `pin_stats` on the Pin object to obtain impression and engagement data for a particular pin. ##### Pin Stats for standard pin { "type":"root", "24h":{ "last_updated":"Wed, 12 February 2020 23:00:00", "save":0, "closeup":0, "impression":4, "clickthrough":0 }, "7d":{ "last_updated":"Tue, 11 February 2020 00:00:00", "save":0, "closeup":1, "impression":42, "clickthrough":0 }, "30d":{ "last_updated":"Tue, 11 February 2020 00:00:00", "save":0, "closeup":3, "impression":179, "clickthrough":0 }, "90d":{ "last_updated":"Tue, 11 February 2020 00:00:00", "save":1, "closeup":8, "impression":304, "clickthrough":3 } } ##### Pin stats for video pin { "type":"root", "24h":{ "video_views":399, "save":9, "video_average_time":8801, "last_updated":"Tue, 18 February 2020 13:00:00", "clickthrough":1 }, "7d":{ "video_views":2897, "save":51, "video_average_time":9842, "last_updated":"Sun, 16 February 2020 00:00:00", "clickthrough":4 }, "30d":{ "video_views":16232, "save":297, "video_average_time":10980, "last_updated":"Sun, 16 February 2020 00:00:00", "clickthrough":26 }, "90d":{ "video_views":16232, "save":297, "video_average_time":10980, "last_updated":"Sun, 16 February 2020 00:00:00", "clickthrough":26 }, "all_time":{ "video_views":339916, "save":4420, "video_average_time":9813, "last_updated":"Mon, 17 February 2020 00:00:00", "clickthrough":484 } }   ## Ad Group, Campaign, and Pin promotion Get metadata for Ad Group, Campaign, and Pin promotion with known ID. ##### GET /ads/v3/ad_groups/{ad_group}/ See Ad Group API Reference ##### GET /ads/v3/campaigns/{campaign}/ See Campaign API Reference ##### GET /ads/v3/pin_promotions/{pin_promotion}/ See Pin promotion API Reference   ## Organic metrics These endpoints are comparable to data obtained on Pinterest Analytics for business accounts, providing user and general Pin metrics such as impressions and engagements.
Helpful link: [Pinterest Analytics overview](https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/pinterest-analytics) ##### GET /v3/partners/analytics/users/{user}/metrics/ See User metrics API Reference | Recommended params | | :----------------- | | start_date | | end_date | | app_types | | pin_format | ##### GET /v3/partners/analytics/users/{user}/pins/top/ See Top pins API Reference | Recommended params | | :----------------- | | start_date | | end_date | | sort_by_metrics | | app_types | | num_of_pins | | pin_format |
#### Metric Definitions | Metric | Definition | | : ---------------- | :--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | IMPRESSION | This is how many times the pin is seen, including in-feed views, follower views, etc. | | ENGAGEMENT | This is how many times the pin is interacted with including: Saves, Closeups, and link Clicks. | | ENGAGEMENT RATE | The rate at which the interactions occurred. | | CLOSEUP | This is how many times the pin has been clicked to close up. | | CLOSEUP RATE | This is the rate of closeups. | | CLICKTHROUGH | This is link clicks from the pin. | | CLICKTHROUGH_RATE | This is the rate of link clicks from the pin. | | SAVE | This is how many times the pin has been saved by other users. | | SAVE_RATE | This is the rate of saves. | ##### GET /v3/partners/analytics/users/{user}/pins/top/video/ See Top video pins API Reference | Recommended params | | :----------------- | | start_date | | end_date | | sort_by_metrics | | app_types | | num_of_pins | | pin_format |
#### Video Metric Definitions | Video Metric | Definition | | : ---------------------- | :------------------------------------------ | | CLICKTHROUGH | Top link clicks. | | IMPRESSION | Total impressions. | | QUARTILE_95_PERCENT_VIEW | Total 95% views. | | SAVE | Total saves. | | VIDEO_10S_VIEW | Total 10-second views | | VIDEO_AVG_WATCH_TIME | The average time people watched your video. | | VIDEO_MRC_VIEW | Total video views | | VIDEO_START | Total number of video starts | | VIDEO_V50_WATCH_TIME | Total watch time (minutes) |   ## Advertising These endpoints expose the most commonly requested advertising metrics on Pinterest. Hierarchy for ads on Pinterest are the following: Advertiser > Campaign > Ad Group > Pin. Conversion metrics are only available for advertisers who have [installed the Pinterest Tag](https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/set-up-the-pinterest-tag). ##### GET /ads/v3/resources/delivery_metrics/ See Delivery metrics definitions API Reference ##### GET /ads/v3/advertisers/ See Delivery Get advertiser accounts API Reference ##### POST /ads/v3/reports/async/{advertiser}/delivery_metrics/ See Request report API Reference | Recommended params | | :--------------------- | | advertiser | | start_date | | end_date | | granularity | | click_window_days | | engagement_window_days | | view_window_days | | entity_fields |
#### Common attribution window combinations | click days/engagement days/view days | | :------------------------------------------ | | 60/60/ [60,30,7,1] (e.g 60/60/60, 60/60/30) | | 60/30/ [30,7,1] | | 60/7/ [7, 1] | | 60/1/1 | | 30/60/1 | | **30/30/** [30, 7, **1**] | | 30/7/ [7, 1] | | 30/1/1 | | 7/7/ [7, 1] | | 7/1/1 | **Note:** Default is 30 days after click, 30 days after engagement, and 1 day after viewing your ad. ##### GET /ads/v3/reports/async/{advertiser}/delivery_metrics/ See Download report API Reference **Note:** Response contains signed URL to the report stored in S3. This URL is valid for 1 hour.   ## Audience Insights These endpoints surface data for a users audience, including affinity to categories and interests, and demographic breakdown of the audience selection by age, gender, location and device. A users audience is defined as anyone who has seen or engaged with a Pin from the user within the last 30 days.
Helpful link: [Audience Insights](https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/audience-insights) ##### GET /ads/v3/advertisers/{advertiser}/insights/audiences/ Get available audience scope and type for insights ##### GET /ads/v3/advertisers/{advertiser}/insights/audience/{scope}/{type}/ Get insights metrics for a given audience scope and type ##### GET /ads/v3/advertisers/{advertiser}/insights/audience/{scope}/{type}/{category}/ Get category sub-interest information
#### Scopes | Name | Scope | Update Freq | Range | | ---- | :----------- | ----------- | ----- | | /partner/impression_plus_engagement | All users who viewed (impressions) or engaged (clicks, saves, closeups) with pins within your profile, or pins from claimed accounts (domain, youtube, etsy, instagram) | Weekly | Last 30 days | | /partner/engagement/ | All users who engaged (cicks, saves, closeups) with pins within partner profile, or pins from partner claimed accounts. | Weekly | Last 30 days | | /pinterest/impression_plus_engagement | All pinterest users with a view and/or engagement (impressions, clicks, closeups, saves) | Weekly | Last 30 days | | /pinterest/engagement | All pinterest users with an engagement (clicks, closeups, saves) | Weekly | Last 30 days | | Custom | Custom audience list uploaded to ads manager; matched with pinterest users who have interests available | One time | n/a | **Note:** Audiences with a population of less than 100 will return no data
#### Audience Dimensions | Name | Type | Description | | ---- | ---- | ----------- | | Category | Interest Taxonomy | Audience Level 1 L1 interests | | Category Interest | Interest Taxonomy | Audience Sub-level L2 interests breakdown within L1 category | | Age | Demographic| User age distribution | | Gender | Demographic | User gender distribution | | Location - Top Metros | Demographic | User metro area | | Location - Top Countries | Demographic | User countries (from profile setting) | | Device | Demographic | User device usage | #### Audience Limits
Name Definition
Categories (L1) All L1 categories sorted by % of audience. Affinity (index) is compared to Pinterests overall audience and therefore only returned for users and custom audiences.
Category Interests Top 50 sorted by either affinity or % of audience (see below) - affinity is only returned for partner and custom audiences, not pinterest wide audiences.
Top Metros Top 10 metros only
Top Countries Top 50 countries + other
Gender bucketed [Male, Female, Unspecified + Custom]
Age 18+ only, bucketed [18-24, 25-34, 35-44, 45-54, 45-54, 55-64, 65+]
Device bucketed [iPhone, iPad, Android Mobile, Android Tablet, Mobile Web, Web]
#### Measures
Name Description
% of audience Percent of audience who falls within a particular dimension.
  • Overlapping - Categories, Category Interest, Device
  • Mutually Exclusive - Top Metros
  • Mutually Exclusive + Exhaustive - Age, Gender, Countries (due to other)
Affinity Measure of strength for partners audience in a particular category or category interest compared to the pinterest wide audience.
Audience Size Total audience size represented by the audience.
#### Measure Limits
Name Definition
% of audience Age, Gender, Device - Values that are less than 5% are returned as 0.049
% of audience Age, Gender, Device - Values that are greater than 95% are returned as 0.951
Audience Size Audiences of <= 100 will not be returned; values <= 10000 will be returned as 10000, value > 10000 are rounded to nearest 10k or 100k
  ## Account Sharing examples If you are interested in accessing data via account sharing, please ensure the accounts are setup correctly by referencing this guide [Setup Account Sharing](#tag/Account-Sharing) #### Access data via Account Sharing for Advertising endpoints Users granted access to an advertiser account have access to the advertiser data for the advertiser endpoints listed in this guide. No additional steps are required. #### Access data via Account Sharing for Organic endpoints Users granted access to an advertiser account have access to the advertiser owner user id's data for the organic endpoints listed in this guide. These endpoints require an additional parameter.
Param Type Description
advertiser_id Integer The advertiser id that is shared with the user.
Example: - `userA` shares advertiser account `123` with `userB` - `userB` grants access to the requesting platform - `userB` has access to `userA`'s data GET /v3/partners/analytics/users/userA/metrics/?advertiser_id=123&access_token=userb_access_token
tags.name: Quick Start: Reporting

tags.description:
**Note:** Only reference this guide if you have been instructed to migrate over from an older Creator Stats integration.
- User profile stats - Creator Pin stats #### Definitions | Name | Definition | | ------------- | ---------- | | Creator | The Pinterest user | | Platform Authorization | **Client Authorization.** No user grant required for access to Pinterest data. This type of access returns limited and public information about the User or Pin. See [Client Authorization](#section/Client-Authorization)| | User Authorization | Explicit user grant required for the 3rd party to access Pinterest data. This type of access returns a complete User and Pin profile. See [User Authorization](#section/User-Authorization) | | Business account | Indicated by `is_partner` key in the user response. More info about [creating a Business account here](https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/get-a-business-account) | The Creator stats accessible through the Analytics API will vary based on the level of authorization given per Pinterest profile.
If a platform is interested in more metrics pertaining to a specific User and/or Pin, then `User Authorization` is needed from the creator. Only a sample of creator fields accessible by `Client Authorization` is broken down below. For `User Authoriztion` samples, please see the individual API Reference links for more info.   ## User profile stats Retrieve the user's profile metadata such as follower count, business profile status, about, the users unique monthly viewer count over the last 30 days known as Profile reach, etc.
**Note:** `profile_reach` is only available if the user profile is a business account otherwise it will read `-1`. ##### GET /v3/users/{user}/ ##### Client Authorization sample { "status": "success", "code": 0, "data": { "pin_count": 14, "id": "591660607204455372", "is_partner": true, "follower_count": 5, "about": "Piny things! ", "profile_reach": 7074, "username": "pintestdeveloperuser" }, "message": "ok", "endpoint_name": "v3_get_user_handler" }
See User API Reference
**Note:** You will need to opt for [User Authorization](#section/User-Authorization) access in order to see additional fields such as `image_urls`, `first and last name`, `gender`, `location`, etc.
  ## Creator Pin stats Retrieve the pin's metadata such as the image url, pin description, 1/7/30/90 day stats referred to as Pin stats on standard and video pins, etc.
**Note:** `comment_count` is a deprecated field and will be removed. If you have a usecase that requires access to the pin's comments, please reach out directly for steps on how to access.
**Note:** `pin_stats` is currently only available via `User Authorization` and must be owned by creator in order to be surfaced.
[See Pin stats](#section/Pin-stats) ##### GET /v3/users/{user}/pins/ ##### Client Authorization sample { "status": "success", "code": 0, "data": [{ "repin_count": 1, "image_medium_size_pixels": { "width": 400, "height": 223 }, "pinned_to_board": null, "image_medium_url": "https://i.pinimg.com/400x/68/c7/70/68c77000716bf352fc55360d844566d0.jpg", "image_square_url": "https://i.pinimg.com/90x90/68/c7/70/68c77000716bf352fc55360d844566d0.jpg", "id": "591660469788654081", "image_large_size_pixels": { "width": 600, "height": 334 }, "description": " ", "image_square_size_pixels": { "width": 90, "height": 90 }, "link": null, "image_square_size_points": { "width": 45, "height": 45 }, "image_large_size_points": { "width": 600, "height": 334 }, "comment_count": 0, "image_medium_size_points": { "width": 200, "height": 111 }, "image_large_url": "https://i.pinimg.com/600x/68/c7/70/68c77000716bf352fc55360d844566d0.jpg", "video_signature": null, "is_video": false, "created_at": "Tue, 18 Aug 2020 18:34:36 +0000", "type": "pin", "attribution": null, "rich_metadata": { "id": "" } }], "message": "ok", "endpoint_name": "v3_get_pins_handler", "bookmark": "P2M1OTE2NjA0Njk3ODg2NTQwODEuMTU5Nzc3NTY3NnwxfDUxNjdmNjhjZWM5YjNlNjc1Nzg3MDU4MTJmZDViYTlkYzIxNzI2MDE0NGI3MzJmNWIwZGM5YTZkZmQyZjExNDJ8TkVXfA==" }
See User Pins API Reference
**Note:** You will need to opt for [User Authorization](#section/User-Authorization) access in order to see additional fields.
##### GET /v3/pins/{pin}/ ##### Client Authorization sample { "status": "success", "code": 0, "data": { "image_medium_size_pixels": { "width": 400, "height": 223 }, "image_large_url": "https://i.pinimg.com/600x/68/c7/70/68c77000716bf352fc55360d844566d0.jpg", "type": "pin", "description": " ", "image_square_size_pixels": { "width": 90, "height": 90 }, "pinned_to_board": null, "link": null, "is_video": false, "image_medium_size_points": { "width": 200, "height": 111 }, "image_large_size_points": { "width": 600, "height": 334 }, "repin_count": 1, "comment_count": 0, "image_large_size_pixels": { "width": 600, "height": 334 }, "image_square_url": "https://i.pinimg.com/90x90/68/c7/70/68c77000716bf352fc55360d844566d0.jpg", "attribution": null, "rich_metadata": { "id": "" }, "video_signature": null, "image_medium_url": "https://i.pinimg.com/400x/68/c7/70/68c77000716bf352fc55360d844566d0.jpg", "created_at": "Tue, 18 Aug 2020 18:34:36 +0000", "id": "591660469788654081", "image_square_size_points": { "width": 45, "height": 45 } }, "message": "ok", "endpoint_name": "v3_get_pin" }
See Pin API Reference
**Note:** You will need to opt for [User Authorization](#section/User-Authorization) access in order to see additional fields. ***

tags.description:
Reference this guide if you wish to upload videos to a pinner's account, create video pins, and obtain usage metrics.


These endpoints require User Authorization. For a third-party to conduct operations on its data, a pinner has to give Pinterest authorization to do so. This requires:


  1. The pinner has a Pinterest business account. Accounts can be converted into business accounts from the Settings option at Pinterest.com, or new business accounts can be created. For Pinterest business account details, click here.


  2. The pinner's account's "Country" setting is in a Pinterest advertising market. To see an advertising market overview, click here.

    Note: The language setting doesn't matter here. A pinner with language = English in Japan CANNOT upload a video (as of 05/11/2019) and a pinner with language = Spanish in Canada CAN upload a video. Either that, or the pinner is whitelisted. In this case, Pinterest makes special allowances for certain pinners. See your Pinterest contact to be whitelisted.


  3. Follow the steps as described in User Authorization to get your OAuth token for accessing APIs.
## Using video APIs To begin with, you should make sure your video media meets Pinterest requirements. See Pinterest product specs for more information.

To create a video pin:


  1. Register and upload your video. Register your media with Pinterest and upload it to Pinterest AWS (Amazon Web Services) cloud storage. See our Register and upload media API.


    To check your media upload's status, you can call the following APIs:

    • Get media upload status(es) - Get status per upload ID.
    • Get user media upload status(es) - Get status for calling user.

  2. Create a video pin. Once successfully uploaded, you can use your media to create a video pin. See our Create pin API for details. See also Video Pins for more information.


  3. Check your video pin's review status. Once created, Pinterest needs to approve your video pin. See the Check video review status API.

Optionally, use your video pin to create a pin promotion. See the Create pin promotion API. ## Video pin metrics and analytics

There is one API that specifically returns metrics about video pins:


  • Get user's top video pin metrics - This API returns analytic data about a user's top video pins (up to 100). Video pin metric descriptions can be found here.
#### Related APIs
  • Get organic pin - Returns a pin object containing details about a specific pin.
  • Get user's top pin metrics - This API returns analytic data about a user's top pins (up to 100). Pin metric descriptions can be found here.
***

# June 2022 **Summary of changes for June** - Deprecation of Get Related Keywords endpoint - API support for Idea ads ## Deprecation of Get Related Keywords endpoint Due to low partner usage, we have decided to deprecate the [GET /ads/v4/advertisers/{advertiser_id}/keywords/related](https://developers.pinterest.com/docs/redoc/adtech_ads_v4/#operation/get_related_keywords_handler) endpoint. On June 30, 2022 we will enforce an end of life where any requests to this endpoint will receive a 410 error. The following endpoints can continue to be utilized to pull similar information: - [GET /ads/v4/terms/related](https://developers.pinterest.com/docs/redoc/adtech_ads_v4/#operation/get_related_terms_handler) - [GET /ads/v4/terms/suggested](https://developers.pinterest.com/docs/redoc/adtech_ads_v4/#operation/get_suggested_terms_handler) ## Idea ads ### Ad Creation (promoting Idea Pins) To promote an Idea Pin, Send a POST request to: https://api.pinterest.com/ads/ads/v4/advertisers/{advertiser_id}/ads 1. Set "creative_type" to "STORY" 2. Set "destination_url" as it is required for Idea ads 3. Set "pin" to an Idea Pin id. ### Reporting Reporting changes are the same as the reporting changes for Idea Pins with paid partnership with the exception of video metrics. #### Video metrics Our video metrics are calculated as follows: - We treat all videos and images within an Idea ad as one video and calculate standard video metrics across this video. Eg: for Video 1 (10 sec) | Image 2 (5 seconds) | Video 3 (10 sec), the total video length is 10+5+10 = 25 sec - Image pages will always auto advance after 5 seconds if the Idea ad is viewed in full screen - The total video length is counted as watch time if the user auto-advanced from one page to the next - We only count actual watchtime if the user skips to the next video or image card. Eg: If a user watched 3 seconds of Video 1, we count 3 secs of watchtime and not 10 secs. If a user spent 2 seconds on Image 2 while it is autoadvancing, we count 2 secs of watchtime and not 5 secs. # March 2022 **Summary of changes for March** - Ads API v3 shutdown - Update to top pins metric sort options ## Ads API v3 Shutdown Ads API v3 has come to an end of life starting today March 1st, 2022. From now on, all ads/v3 endpoints will return a 410 error response. Please make requests to Ads API v4. Check out the v3 to v4 migration guide for an overview of the new changes. Learn more about our new ads v4 bulk features. ## Update to top pins metric sort options ##### GET /v3/partners/analytics/users/{user}/pins/top/ We are removing support for sorting by rates in the [top pins endpoint](#operation/v3_analytics_partner_top_pins_GET). The updated list of supported metrics for the sort_by parameter is impressions, engagements, pin clicks, outbound clicks, and saves. # November 2021 **Summary of changes for November** - Enhancements to Engagement Audiences - Deprecation of Top Repins endpoint ## Engagement Audiences ### New engagement action options We are simplifying the process of creating engagement audiences by introducing the option to create engagement audiences from Pinners who have performed any engagement action or optimized engagement actions. - With any engagement action, you can reach audiences who have performed any engagement action such as video viewed %, Pin clicks, outbound clicks, saves, and comments with the advertisers content. With optimized engagement actions, Pinners are automatically selected based on their high intent actions such as saves and outbound clicks to help you get the best results. - The ability to create engagement audiences by selecting action types and % video viewed options will be removed, as these options will be automatically included in the any engagement action and optimized engagement actions segments. - The filters (Pin category and destination URL) and inputs for the lookback window will be removed as well. - The Pin id filter will no longer support not equals operation. Changes to rule API param: 1. Added field engager_type with values 1 (all engagers) or 2 (optimized engagers). Example: engager_type: 2 2. Removed fields prefill, retention_days, url, engagement_type, pin_category, pin_video_view 3. Update pin_id fields to a list of pinIDs only, operations are removed. Example: "pin_id":{"=":["229754018470533878"]} changed to "pin_id":["229754018470533878"]. We will no longer support "pin_id":{"!=":["229754018470533878"]} ### Claimed domain updates We are removing the claimed domain requirement to make it easier for all advertisers to create engagement audiences. - Advertisers without a claimed domain will now be able to create engagement audiences off user activity on their promoted and organic content. - Advertisers can select multiple claimed domains Changes to rule API param: 1. engagement_domain field becomes an optional list. Example: engagement_domain: ["mydomain.com, mydomain2.com] Advertisers with claimed domains can continue using claimed assets as data sources to increase the reach of their engagement audiences. - Advertisers who claim their domain can continue to grow their engagement audiences based on user activity on Pinterest. - This includes Pins that link out to claimed domains that exist on sites such as Etsy and YouTube. ### Targeting based on specific ad, campaign, or objective types We are introducing the ability to create engagement audiences based on interactions with specific Pins, ads, campaigns, or campaign objectives. - Advertisers can create engagement audiences based on their Pin IDs, ad IDs, campaign IDs, or campaign objectives. With this functionality, advertisers can sequence messaging and guide audiences from inspiration to action. - An engagement audience can only have at most one of these filters. Changes to rule API param: 1. Pin ID: "pin_id":["796222409119557197","796222409119557198"] 2. Ad ID: "g_pin_promotion_id":["687224702315","687224702193"] 3. Campaign ID: "g_campaign_id":["626744680725","626744680640"] 4. Campaign objective: "objective":["AWARENESS","TRAFFIC","CATALOG_SALES","WEB_CONVERSION","VIDEO_VIEW"] ## Deprecation of Top Repins endpoint We will deprecate the top repins endpoint (/v3/domains//pins/top/repins/) on December 15th, 2021. If you currently use this endpoint, it will no longer be supported past that date. To fetch the top repins for a partner, please use the [top pins endpoint](#operation/v3_analytics_partner_top_pins_GET), with the sort_by_metrics parameter set to "SAVE". # September 2021 **Summary of changes for September** - API support for Idea ads (beta) ## Idea ads (beta) ### Ad Creation (promoting Idea Pins) To promote an Idea Pin, Send a POST request to: https://api.pinterest.com/ads/ads/v4/advertisers/{advertiser_id}/ads 1. Set "creative_type" to "STORY" 2. Set "destination_url" as it is required for Idea ads 3. Set "pin" to an Idea Pin id. ### Reporting Reporting changes are the same as the reporting changes for Idea Pins with paid partnership. - API support for Slideshow for Collections ## Slideshow for Collections ### Ad Creation To create a slideshow promotion, use the same API call as you would to promote a regular product group or a standard collection. Just make these adjustments: 1. Set "creative_type" to "SHOP_THE_PIN" 2. Set "collections_hero_pin_id" to null 3. Set "collections_hero_destination_url" to your desired hero landing page 4. Set "slideshow_collections_title" to your desired slideshow title 5. Set optional fields, e.g. status, tracking_url, and slideshow_collections_description Send the data in the body of a POST request to: https://api.pinterest.com/ads/v4/advertisers/{advertiser_id}/promoted_product_groups/. See the example below for more information. Request body: { "ad_group_id": "1234", "promoted_catalog_product_groups": [ { "status": "ACTIVE", "catalog_product_group_id": "1234", "creative_type": "SHOP_THE_PIN", "collections_hero_destination_url": "http://www.mylandingpage.com", "slideshow_collections_title": "My Slideshow Title" } ] } You should receive a response as follows: { "status": "success", "code": 0, "data": [ { "data": { "collections_hero_destination_url": "http://www.mylandingpage.com", "slideshow_collections_title": "My Slideshow Title", "tracking_url": null, "id": "1234", "parent_id": null, "definition": "*/", "bid_in_micro_currency": 0, "creative_type": "SHOP_THE_PIN", "collections_hero_pin_id": null, "relative_definition": "*/", "catalog_product_group_id": "1234", "ad_group_id": "1234", "type": "productgroup", "catalog_product_group_name": "CPG Name", "slideshow_collections_description": null, "status": "ACTIVE", "included": null } } ], "message": "ok", "endpoint_name": "create_promoted_catalog_product_groups_handler" } ### Reporting The API requests for Slideshow Collections reporting are the same as for Standard Collections reporting. The same set of columns will be available. # August 2021 **Summary of changes for August** - API support for Idea ads with paid partnership ## Idea ads with paid partnership ### Ad Creation (promoting Idea Pins with paid partnership) To promote an Idea Pin with paid partnership, Send a POST request to: https://api.pinterest.com/ads/ads/v4/advertisers/{advertiser_id}/ads 1. Set "creative_type" to "STORY" 2. Set "destination_url" as it is required for Idea ads 3. Set "pin" to an eligible* Pin id. *The Pin must be an Idea Pin with paid partnership. An Idea Pin with paid partnership is an Idea Pin created by a creator, not the current advertiser. The current advertiser is the partner paying the creator for the Pin. The sponsorship relationship between the Pin and the advertiser is established during Pin creation in the Idea Pin builder using the paid partnership tool. The advertiser must approve the paid partnership tag by going directly to the Pin on a desktop web browser. #### Audiences Setting the ads target audience is managed through the Advertisers account. You are unable to target the Creators audiences at this time. ### Reporting The API requests for Idea ads reporting are the same as standard ad reporting, with the addition of these columns: - IDEA_PIN_PAGE_FORWARD_1 - IDEA_PIN_PAGE_FORWARD_2 - IDEA_PIN_PAGE_BACKWARD_1 - IDEA_PIN_PAGE_BACKWARD_2 - TOTAL_IDEA_PIN_PAGE_FORWARD - TOTAL_IDEA_PIN_PAGE_BACKWARD As with other columns, the _1 suffix indicates paid metrics, the _2 earned metrics, and TOTAL_ columns are the sum of the two. These metrics will be aggregated into the engagement metric as well. Detailed definitions or tooltips for each metric are below - Earned Idea Pin page forward: The number of times someone advances to a new page within your Idea Pin on someone else's board - Paid Idea Pin page forward: The number of times someone advances to a new page to a new page within an Idea Pin you promoted - Earned Idea Pin page backward: The number of times someone goes back to a previous page within your Idea Pin on someone else's board - Paid Idea Pin page backward: The number of times someone goes back to a previous page within an Idea Pin you promoted - Total Idea Pin page forward: The total number of times someone advances to a new page within an Idea Pin, including paid and earned - Total Idea Pin page backward: The total number of times someone goes back to a previous page within an Idea Pin, including paid and earned #### Video metrics When an idea ad includes video assets, our video metrics are calculated as follows: - We treat all videos within an idea ad as one video and calculate standard video metrics across this video Eg: for Video 1 (1 min) | Video 2 (2 mins) | Video 3 (1 min), the total video length is 1+2+1 = 4 mins - This aggregation occurs even if multiple videos are separated by static assets Eg: for Video 1 (1 min) | Image 2 | Video 2 (2 mins) | Image 2 | Video 3 (1 min), the total video length is 1+2+1 = 4 mins - We only count actual watchtime if the user skips to the next video card Eg: If a user watched 10 seconds of Video 1, we count 10 secs of watchtime and not 1 min) - The total video length is counted as watch time if the user auto-advanced from one video card to the next # July 2021 **Summary of changes for July** - Ads API v4 released - Ads API v3 will be deprecated in January 2022   ## Ads API v4 release ### To access API v4 documentation Go to your Pinterest API admin page to see the standalone endpoint docs for v4 ### New Features / Global Changes #### New Bulk API Bulk APIs are introduced for batch creating, updating and downloading any of advertiser entities (including campaigns, ad groups, ads, keywords and product groups) in a single request. The bulk request is processed asynchronously, and request status fetched using the request id. Once a request completes successfully, a download url is provided in the request status. **Ex: POST /ads/v4/advertisers//bulk_upsert/**
(bulk create/update entities endpoint, new feature in v4) **Ex: POST /ads/v4/advertisers//bulk_get/**
(bulk get entities endpoint) **Ex: GET /ads/v4/advertisers//bulk/**
(get bulk request status endpoint) ### Pin promotions are now "ads" As part of a larger consistency and clarity change throughout our products - everywhere we used the term "pin_promotion/pin_promotions" we now use "ad/ads". **Ex: GET /ads/v4/advertisers//ads//**
(get a single ad endpoint) NOTE: early in the v4 launch some places in our documentation may still refer to "promoted pins" or "pin promotions" - we're working on updating all these references to be ad/ads ### Endpoints prefixed with "/advertisers//" Endpoint paths that deal with the advertiser object or any child objects (campaigns, tags, campaigns, etc) are now prefixed with "/advertisers//" to clarify this relationship. By requiring the advertiser ID to be passed in the URI, we hope to minimize confusion when managing multiple advertiser accounts. This also allows us to assign rate limits differently (see "Ratelimit quotas assigned by advertiser ID" below). **Ex: GET /ads/v4/advertisers//campaigns//**
(get a single campaign endpoint) ### All parameters and returned responses now use snake_case (previously some were camelCase) All object type fields now will use snake case formatting. **Ex: For ad groups, You may get optimization_goal_metadata.conversionTagV3GoalMetadata in v3 but this will be optimization_goal_metadata.conversion_tag_v3_goal_metadata in v4.** ### Campaign objective type updates **APP_INSTALL** objective has been deprecated.
**TRAFFIC** objective has been renamed to CONSIDERATION.
Please note these changes have not been fully updated in the documentation. We are working on publishing the fix soon. ### Rate limit header format changed, only returned if request is limited We now only return rate limit headers when your request is limited. The format of the rate limit headers has also been updated to align with the IETF RateLimit headers draft spec. In v3 - the following headers were returned on every request:
x-userendpoint-ratelimit-limit
x-userendpoint-ratelimit-remaining
x-userendpoint-ratelimit-reset-seconds
In v4 - the following headers will ONLY be returned when the request has been limited. RateLimit-Limit - provides information about the limit that has been reached including the quota and time window that apply
RateLimit-Remaining - will be 0, indicating there is no more quota to expend
Retry-After - minimum time (in seconds) before you should attempt to make another request, but not a guarantee that your request will be successful after this time
**Example #1 - per user limit**
A per user or advertiser limit has been reached (but your app overall can continue to make requests). RateLimit-Limit: 30, 30;w=60
RateLimit-Remaining: 0
Retry-After: 30
The limit quota here is defined as "30;w=60" or "30 requests per 60 seconds". The reset field indicates there are 30 seconds left in the window that this limit was triggered. **Example #2 - per app (aka "client") limit**
A per app limit has been reached (but the specific user you are making requests for is not being limited). RateLimit-Limit: 1000, 1000;w=60
RateLimit-Remaining: 0
Retry-After: 30
The limit quota here is defined as "1000;w=60" or "1000 requests per 60 seconds". The reset field indicates there are 30 seconds left in the window that this limit was triggered. **Example #3 - Pinterest backend service limit**
In the case of downstream capacity/availability issues with our internal systems - we may apply a generic limit that isn't necessarily related to your app's or users' behavior. RateLimit-Limit: 0, 0
RateLimit-Remaining: 0
Retry-After: 2
Reminder: the `Retry-After` value here is the minimum time your client should wait before making another request, but not a guarantee that your request will be successful. ### Hidden "is_managed" campaigns fully visible Previously, campaigns with the "is_managed" field set to "true" would be hidden and not included in certain endpoint results. The is_managed field was a remnant of a Pinterest Ads Manager functionality that allowed Advertiser and account teams to hide the campaign from being exposed to API partners. We found it was often not used correctly and created too much confusion. In v4 we have removed this field and we no longer hide or filter these campaigns. ### Pagination supported on more endpoints Standard pagination functionality (with a default page size of 25 records) is now supported on more endpoints, including: product groups, reporting, and tag management endpoints. Youll be able to find details of each specific endpoint that now uses pagination below. ### Batch operations for campaigns, ad groups, and ads You can now use the same URI with different http methods to do batch get, create, and update operations. **Examples:**
GET /advertisers//campaigns/ -> Batch get campaigns
POST /advertisers//campaigns/ -> Batch create campaigns
PATCH /advertisers//campaigns/ -> Batch update campaigns
For batch get operations - you will be able to optionally filter by a list of arbitrary entity IDs, or parent entity IDs (among other things). For batch create and update operations - you must use the "content-type": "application/json" header and pass an array of objects. **Ex: POST /advertisers/{advertiser_id}/campaigns/** [ { "advertiser_id": 549755885175, "name": "ACME Tools Campaign #1", "status": "ACTIVE", "lifetime_spend_cap": 1432744744, "daily_spend_cap": 1432744744, "order_line_id": 549755885175, "tracking_urls": {}, "mobile_measurement_partner": "APPSFLYER", "measurement_partner_campaign_id": "549755885175", "objective_type": "AWARENESS" }, { "advertiser_id": 549755885175, "name": "ACME Tools Campaign #2", "status": "ACTIVE", "lifetime_spend_cap": 1432744744, "daily_spend_cap": 1432744744, "order_line_id": 549755885175, "tracking_urls": {}, "mobile_measurement_partner": "APPSFLYER", "measurement_partner_campaign_id": "549755885175", "objective_type": "AWARENESS" } ] # June 2021 **Summary of changes for June** - Deprecating two product feed endpoints   ## Deprecating two product feed endpoints We have deprecated the following endpoints ##### GET /ads/v3/product_feeds/default/metadata/counts/ ##### GET /ads/v3/product_feeds/default/metadata/{attribute_name}/ # February 2021 **Summary of changes for February** - Reference native_format_type to determine the type of pin. - [Ads] For API endpoints that return compaign objective_type, please disregard WEB_SESSIONS   ## Pin formats To facilitate identification of the type of Pin, please reference the `native_format_type` attribute on the Pin object.
{ "status":"success", "message":"ok", "code":0, "data":{ ..., "ad_creative_type":"REGULAR", "native_format_type":"SINGLE_IMAGE", ..., } }
Pin format enum for native_format_type: - CAROUSEL - COLLAGE_PIN - LENS_IMAGE - PLACE - SINGLE_IMAGE - STORYBOARD - STORY_PIN - VIDEO - VIRTUAL_TRY_ON_IMAGE
You may also reference `ad_creative_type` to determine type of Pin for Pin promotion purposes (ad formats). See [Creative type enum](#section/Creative-type)   ## [Ads] disregard campaign objective_type WEB_SESSIONS For API endpoints that return campaign objective type, you may notice a new objective type WEB_SESSIONS. Please disregard this option as it is not yet available for advertisers to use. # January 2021 **Summary of changes for January** - Pin Create endpoint now has option to include alternative text - [Analytics and Ads] Updated click reporting metrics - [Analytics] Removal of curated content from analytics   ## Pin Create endpoint now has option to include alternative text When using the [create endpoint](#operation/v3_create_pin_handler_PUT) , you can now include alternative text for improved accessibility.   ## Updated click reporting metrics Were launching a number of updates to our metrics to help business account users better meet their objectives and optimize their content. If you work with advertisers or creators with business accounts, these updates will give you a more complete understanding of performance, both paid and organic, on Pinterest.
You can find a comprehensive list of updates for paid ads and organic content within [this article](https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/review-new-and-updated-reporting-metrics). Technical details are as described below.
Click metrics across both paid and organic platforms will also be unified for consistency and additional clarity. This build is mandatory, and we ask that partners implement these updates by January 21, 2021 midnight UTC (or January 20, 2021, 5pm PT).
**Note:** For the organic endpoints, we will continue to support calls for the legacy metrics (CLOSEUP, CLICKTHROUGH, CLOSEUP_RATE, and CLICKTHROUGH_RATE) in parallel with the new metrics (PIN_CLICK, OUTBOUND_CLICK, PIN_CLICK_RATE, OUTBOUND_CLICK_RATE) for 1 month (until February 21, 2021) at which point we will deprecate the legacy metrics.
**Summary of changes:** * Updating metrics naming from Link clicks to Pin clicks * Introducing new metrics: Outbound clicks [For detailed information about the changes please reference the document linked HERE.](https://business.pinterest.com/sub/business/API-Release-Docs/API_+Click+metrics+updates.pdf)
[For detailed information about the metrics that are changing please reference the document linked HERE.](https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/review-new-and-updated-reporting-metrics) #### Advertising changes ##### GET /ads/v3/resources/delivery_metrics/ See Delivery metrics definitions API Reference
**Change:** response
**Deprecate:** CLOSEUP_1, CLOSEUP_2 **New:** OUTBOUND_CLICK_1, OUTBOUND_CLICK_2
**Change to existing metrics:** CLICKTHROUGH_1, CLICKTHROUGH_2, CLICKTHROUGH_1_GROSS

**Example Response:**
{ "status": "success", "code": 0, "data": { "metrics": [{ "name": "CLICKTHROUGH_1", "definition": "Paid pin~~link~~ clicks" }, { "name": "CLICKTHROUGH_2", "definition": "Earned pin~~link~~ clicks" }, { "name": "CLICKTHROUGH_1_GROSS", "definition": "Gross pin~~link~~ clicks" }, ~~{ "name": "CLOSEUP_1", "definition": "Paid closeups" }, { "name": "CLOSEUP_2", "definition": "Earned closeups" }~~, { "name": "OUTBOUND_CLICK_1", "definition": "Paid outbound clicks" }, { "name": "OUTBOUND_CLICK_2", "definition": "Earned outbound clicks" }...] }, "message": "ok", "endpoint_name": "ads_v3_get_delivery_metrics_handler" }
##### POST /ads/v3/reports/async/{advertiser}/delivery_metrics/ See Request report API Reference
**Change:** metrics (Request body schema)
**Deprecate:** CLOSEUP_1, CLOSEUP_2 **New:** OUTBOUND_CLICK_1, OUTBOUND_CLICK_2

**Example Request:**
curl --request POST -s https://api.pinterest.com/ads/v3/reports/async/{advertiser_id}/delivery_metrics/?start_date={start_date}&end_date={end_date}&level={level}&metrics=OUTBOUND_CLICK_1,OUTBOUND_CLICK_2&access_token={access_token}
##### GET /ads/v3/advertisers/ See Delivery Get advertiser accounts API Reference **Change:** downloaded metrics report
**Deprecate:** CLOSEUP_1, CLOSEUP_2 **New:** OUTBOUND_CLICK_1, OUTBOUND_CLICK_2

**Example Report:**
{ "{advertiser_id}": [{ "ADVERTISER_ID": {advertiser_id}, ~~"CLOSEUP_2": 0,~~ "DATE": "{date}", ~~"CLOSEUP_1": 0,~~ "CLICKTHROUGH_1": 1, "OUTBOUND_CLICK_1": 0, "OUTBOUND_CLICK_2": 0 }, { "CLICKTHROUGH_1": 1, "CLICKTHROUGH_2": 1, ~~"CLOSEUP_2": 0,~~ ~~"CLOSEUP_1": 0,~~ "OUTBOUND_CLICK_1": 0, "OUTBOUND_CLICK_2": 0, "ADVERTISER_ID": {advertiser_id}, "DATE": "{date}" }] }
#### Organic Changes ##### GET /v3/partners/analytics/users/{user}/metrics/ See User metrics API Reference **Changes:** metric_types (Request body schema), response
**Deprecate:** CLOSEUP, CLOSEUP_RATE, CLICKTHROUGH, CLICKTHROUGH_RATE **New:** PIN_CLICK, PIN_CLICK_RATE, OUTBOUND_CLICK, OUTBOUND_CLICK_RATE
**Note:** CLOSEUP and CLICKTHROUGH will still be usable until February 21, 2021 midnight UTC. They will return the data for PIN_CLICK and OUTBOUND_CLICK, but they will have the response key for CLOSEUP and CLICKTHROUGH. This is simply to maintain backward compatibility as partners migrate to the new metrics.
**Example Request:**
curl -X GET https://api.pinterest.com/v3/partners/analytics/users/{user_id}/metrics/?start_date={start_date}&end_date={start_date}&metric_types=CLICKTHROUGH,CLICKTHROUGH_RATE,OUTBOUND_CLICK,OUTBOUND_CLICK_RATE,CLOSEUP,CLOSEUP_RATE,PIN_CLICK,PIN_CLICK_RATE&access_token={access_token}
**Example Response:**
{ "status": "success", "code": 0, "data": { "all": { "summary_metrics": { ~~"CLICKTHROUGH": 1, "CLICKTHROUGH_RATE": 0.012195121951219513,~~ "OUTBOUND_CLICK":1, "OUTBOUND_CLICK_RATE":0.012195121951219513, ~~"CLOSEUP": 4, "CLOSEUP_RATE": 0.04878048780487805,~~ "PIN_CLICK": 4, "PIN_CLICK_RATE": 0.04878048780487805 }, "daily_metrics": [{ "date": "", "data_status": "READY", "metrics": { ~~"CLICKTHROUGH": 0, "CLICKTHROUGH_RATE": 0.0,~~ "OUTBOUND_CLICK":0, "OUTBOUND_CLICK_RATE":0.0, ~~"CLOSEUP": 0, "CLOSEUP_RATE": 0.0,~~ "PIN_CLICK": 0, "PIN_CLICK_RATE": 0.0 } }] } }, "message": "ok", "endpoint_name": "v3_analytics_partner_metrics" }   ## Removal of curated content from Analytics 3rd party API partners should update their reporting to align with the Pinterest narrative of focusing on created vs curated content. To ease this migration for brands and creators, curated content will still be included by default. This option will be deprecated in late 2021 at which point only created content analytics will be returned. To update your reports and align with Pinterest, provide the `include_curated` parameter to the following endpoints with a value of `0`:
Param Type Description
include_curated Integer Enum: 0 1 2. 0 = get only created content analytics. 1 or 2 = get curated and created content analytics. Default is both.
##### GET /v3/partners/analytics/users/{user}/metrics/ See User metrics API Reference ##### GET /v3/partners/analytics/users/{user}/pins/top/ See Top pins API Reference ##### GET /v3/partners/analytics/users/{user}/pins/top/video/ See Top video pins API Reference
Monthly viewers will change to Monthly views. This audience will only include views of created content. This is because the Monthly viewers metric will drop as a result of these changes, and we want to use this opportunity to move towards the ideal profile metric (lifetime views). This field is present in the user object response as `profile_views`. Please discontinue referencing `profile_reach` as it is now deprecated. # November 2020 **Summary of changes for November** - Deprecation of description field for Save Endpoint   ## Deprecation of description field for Save Endpoint We are deprecating the description field on the [save endpoint](#operation/v3_partner_save_handler_POST) on November 20th. If you currently use this field, it will no longer persist beyond that date. # October 2020 **Summary of changes for October** - Ads: Delivery metrics definitions display name - Documentation updates   ## Ads: Delivery metrics definitions display name Delivery metrics definitions now includes display name when available. ##### GET /ads/v3/resources/delivery_metrics/ [See Delivery metrics definitions API Reference](#operation/ads_v3_get_delivery_metrics_handler_GET)

#### Example definition entries **display name available** { "name": "ADD_TO_CART_COST_PER_ACTION", "definition": "Average cost per add to cart event", "display_name": "CPA (Add to cart)" }
**display name not available** { "name": "ADD_TO_CART_COST_PER_ACTION", "definition": "Average cost per add to cart event" }   ## Documentation updates We recently made changes to our online documentation. Specifically changes to the left hand navigation as well as general updates. Feel free to explore and provide any feedback via the [Contact Us](#section/Feedback) section.
**Note:** If you are coming from the [Manage App](/manage) page, you will already be dropped into the curated list of guides and endpoints on this site that are relevant to your App type. Please see the [Introduction](#tag/Introduction) section to learn more about App types and how to best view relevant endpoints and documentation. # September 2020 **Summary of changes for September** - Ads: Delivery metrics definitions - Multiple redirect uris   ## Ads: Delivery metrics definitions Delivery metrics definitions have been updated for accuracy and to introduce new definition entries. ##### GET /ads/v3/resources/delivery_metrics/ [See Delivery metrics definitions API Reference](#operation/ads_v3_get_delivery_metrics_handler_GET)

#### Example definition **Old** { "description": "CPA (App install)", "name": "APP_INSTALL_COST_PER_ACTION" }
**New** { "definition": "Average cost per app install event", "name": "APP_INSTALL_COST_PER_ACTION" }   ## Multiple Redirect URIs Multiple redirect URIs are now supported! 🎉 You may edit the redirect uris directly when you [manage your App](https://developers.pinterest.com/manage/). 1. Login to your developer manage portal 2. Select the App youd like to update by clicking on app name or icon 3. Under Platforms section input Redirect URIs ***

Sign up to receive email updates on API changes, product launches, and versioning. Depending on the update, your email address may need to be linked to an enabled App ID. You can manage the email associated with your App ID at [Manage your app](https://developers.pinterest.com/manage/) by clicking into a respective App ID and providing a `Technical Contact Email` in the Details section.
Ensure `Business Updates` are enabled within your [notification settings](https://help.pinterest.com/en/article/edit-notification-settings). ***

Access to the Pinterest Marketing API requires an approved App. Please follow the steps below to create an App and Apply for access.

## Apply for an App
- 1. Log into [Pinterest](https://pinterest.com) with the user ID that youll use to manage your developer accounts applications.
- 2. Request approval for a new app [Apply for app](https://developers.pinterest.com/manage/)
- 3. Work with your Pinterest contact to get your newly generated App approved.
- 4. Once approved, be sure to complete your App profile by providing 
    - **Technical Contact email** - This will ensure you are [Subscribed for updates](#tag/Subscribe-for-updates).
    - **Redirect URIs** - This will ensure you can get started with [User Authorization](#section/User-Authorization) as `redirect_uri` is a required field for OAuth.
- 5. You will also now have access to your App ID and App secret as these are required fields for OAuth as well.

## Redirect URIs
Redirect URIs are validated during authorization. Please ensure they are secure (e.g `https`) and do not contain any invalid characters, spaces, missing back slash, etc. The supplied redirect_uri during OAuth will be matched against the redirect URIs list in your App profile and they must be an exact match to avoid any exceptions. The supplied URIs must also be a landing URI and not a redirect.

***
